meanings.definition: A breed of large, powerful hound with a keen sense of smell, used for tracking and hunting.
meanings.sent1: The bloodhounds quickly found the lost child in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The bloodhounds followed the scent trail to locate the missing hiker.
meanings.sent3: The bloodhounds thought it was a game of hide-and-seek when they found the hidden treats.
meanings.sent4: The bloodhounds' noses were like detectives, uncovering the secrets of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The bloodhounds' howls echoed through the night as they pursued their prey.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that relentlessly pursues or investigates something.
meanings.sent1: The journalist was a bloodhound, always seeking the truth behind the stories.
meanings.sent2: The detective was a bloodhound on the trail of the elusive criminal.
meanings.sent3: The bloodhound of gossip sniffed out the latest rumors in town.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was a bloodhound, never letting go until she found the answers.
meanings.sent5: The bloodhound of justice never rested until the guilty party was caught.
